{
  "reasoning": "Let's work this out in a step by step way to be sure we have the right answer. The specified food items are "galettes millet, haricots noirs, maïs," all cooked together as patties visible on the right side of the bowl. There are 5 patties that appear roughly circular, each about 7-8 cm in diameter, typical of homemade millet-based patties. They seem well cooked with slight blackened marks.

To estimate weight, first consider typical Swiss millet patties with black beans and corn. A patty of this size and composition often weighs between 35-50 g depending on density.

Given their slightly charred, flat appearance and visible ingredients (maïs kernels and black beans), and scale relative to the bowl (~18-20 cm diameter) and tomato salad next to it, each patty likely weighs around 40 g.

Multiplying by 5 patties gives 200 g total. This aligns plausibly with usual prepared millet patty weights.

Since the patties likely include black beans and corn mixed inside, estimating the combined weight of millet, black beans, and corn in the 5 patties to be about 200 g is reasonable. No extra unseen volume or containers affect this.

Thus, the estimated weight for "galettes millet, haricots noirs, maïs" is 200 grams.",
  "galettes millet, haricots noirs, maïs": 200
}
